title: datalad install -r fails for studyforrest dataset -- asks for username (private?)
body:
```shell
$> datalad install -r https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data
[INFO   ] Cloning dataset from 'https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data' to '/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data' 
install(ok): /mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data (dataset)
[INFO   ] Installing <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data> recursively 
[INFO   ] Cloning dataset from 'https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data/aligned' to '/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data/aligned' 
[ERROR  ] Failed to clone data from any candidate source URL: ['https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data/aligned', 'https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data/aligned/.git'] 
[INFO   ] Cloning dataset from 'https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data-aligned.git' to '/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data/aligned' 
[INFO   ] Submodule HEAD got detached. Resetting branch master to point to 72b577b3. Original location was 47e53498 
install(ok): aligned (dataset) [Installed subdataset <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data/aligned>]
[INFO   ] Cloning dataset from 'https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data-aligned.git/src/phase1' to '/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data/aligned/src/phase1' 
[ERROR  ] Failed to clone data from any candidate source URL: ['https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data-aligned.git/src/phase1', 'https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/studyforrest-data-aligned.git/src/phase1/.git'] 
[INFO   ] Cloning dataset from 'https://github.com/psychoinformatics-de/phase1' to '/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl-misc/studyforrest/studyforrest-data/aligned/src/phase1' 
Username for 'https://github.com': 
```
